授業目的:
Students will further develop the writing skills they learned in the spring semester
• To help students improve their vocabulary and grammar with a focus on academic writing
• To provide students with a fundamental understanding of the discourse of writing, and to guide the development of their critical thinking skills
• To provide students with guidance and practice in gaining a more advanced understanding of how to use punctuation in academic writing, as well as introducing the concept of using cited research and quotations in academic writing while avoiding plagiarism
• To engage students in writing for fluency through a variety of topics
• To use proper citation in academic writing

At the end of the semester, students should be able to write an effective essay in English in one or more styles. Students are expected to be able to write a structured essay with evidence of critical thinking with an Introduction Paragraph (Hook, Thesis Statement, and Outline), well-supported and clear Body Paragraphs (Topic Sentence, Supporting Sentences, and a Concluding Sentence), and a Conclusion Paragraph (Restatement of Thesis Statement and Summary).
Based on the basic knowledge and skills for writing essays and with the help of research articles in English, students will be able to write research-related-essays. They should also be able to demonstrate written proficiency in English grammar and punctuation via feedback from the instructor.
到達目標:
• Review paragraph structure
• Examine topic sentences
• Learn Institute of Electrical and Electriconics Engineering (IEEE) citation
• Expand from paragraphs to short essays
• Organizing a descriptive short essay
• Using adjectives to add details to sentences

トピック.授業計画1:
Writing Journals
The writing journals are graded practice for the free-writing topics. Writing prompts will be given for each assignment. Students are expected to use proper English writing structures. Feedback will be provided.

Textbook Activities
The textbook is used in the classroom to introduce grammar, vocabulary, and correct writing structures. The students are expected to complete the textbook exercises in a timely manner.

Review Assignments
Review assignments are conducted at the end of each unit. They are intended to show competence with the unit material.

Freewriting topics
The details for the Freewriting Topics will be posted in LUNA.
